body.p: Twenty-first governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from August 30, 1859 to August 18, 1862. Member of the Democratic and Southern Rights Parties. Educated at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky and Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Practiced law in Jackson, Mississippi and Harrodsburg, Kentucky. Real estate investor in Chicago, Illinois. Married Anna Nelson Shelby on April 21, 1840. Father of Susan Shelby Magoffin, Beriah Magoffin, Gertrude Magoffin, Sarah Magoffin, Shelby Magoffin, Isaac Magoffin, Jane Magoffin, Letitia Magoffin, Ebenezer Magoffin, Anna Magoffin, and Samuel Magoffin. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1860. Appointed Harrodsburg Police Judge in 1840. Democratic Party presidential elector in 1856. Delegate to the Democratic national convention in 1848, 1856, 1860, and 1872. Represented Mercer County in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1850. Elected governor in 1859 and resigned in 1862. Served as president of the Military Board of Kentucky from May 1861 to September 1861.

Harrison, Ed., Kentucky’s Governors (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2004), 78-81; “Programme of the Ceremonies of Inauguration, on the 30th August, 1859” Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), August 24, 1859; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort District No. 1, p. 24.
